channel.title: Giveing Items For An Item
channel.description:
After You Beat A Jad You Get A Ticket. You Then Have To Get 5. How Do I Make A Command That Looks For Like 5 Tickets, Then Gives You A Cupple Items For Them, Dleteing Them, And If You Only Have 4 Or Less It Sends You A Message "You Need Five Tickets For That"
Anyone? Thanks. :D

item.title: Giveing Items For An Item
item.dc:creator: @nobiwa666 nobiwa666
item.description:
@nobiwa666 wrote:

pm me the items that u want i make u the code because i already got 1 with buy runes
u need 1m coins and by command u can buy rune:P but heres the command

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“buyfirecape”)) {
if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 25) == false)) {
sendMessage(“You need 25 tokkul.”);
} else if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 25) == true))
addItem(6570,1);
deleteItem(6529, getItemSlot(6529), 25);
}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“buyobbymaul”)) {
if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 20) == false)) {
sendMessage(“You need 20 tokkul.”);
} else if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 20) == true))
addItem(6529,1);
deleteItem(6529, getItemSlot(6529), 20);
}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“buyobbystaff”)) {
if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 15) == false)) {
sendMessage(“You need 15 tokkul.”);
} else if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 15) == true))
addItem(6526,1);
deleteItem(6529, getItemSlot(6529), 15);
}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“buyobbysword”)) {
if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 5) == false)) {
sendMessage(“You need 5 tokkul.”);
} else if ((playerHasItemAmount(6529, 5) == true))
addItem(6523,1);
deleteItem(6529, getItemSlot(6529), 5);
}

code is tested at hiyascape source

Read full topic

item.title: Giveing Items For An Item
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

You dont need a command.
What that does is set a prefix for a specific item amount, then when you get it, it deleted them and adds the next preset item/

Read full topic

item.title: Giveing Items For An Item
item.dc:creator: @Project_Ferrari_Scap Project Ferrari Scape
item.description:
@Project_Ferrari_Scap wrote:

if(playerHasItemAmount(ITEMID, 5)) { deleteItem(ITEMID, getItemSlot(ITEMID), ID); addItem(ITEMID, Amount); } else { sendMessage("You Do not have 5 tickets yet!"; } }

But Weres the Command?

Read full topic

item.title: Giveing Items For An Item
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“guitars595, post:2, topic:237032”] if (command.startsWith("jadreward")) { if(playerHasItemAmount(ITEMID, 5)) { deleteItem(ITEMID, getItemSlot(ITEMID), ID); addItem(ITEMID, Amount); } else { sendMessage("You Do not have 5 tickets yet!"; } Try that[/quote]

Won’t it have 2 closing brackets because theirs 2 “IF” statements?

Something like this.

 if(playerHasItemAmount(ITEMID, 5)) {
      deleteItem(ITEMID, getItemSlot(ITEMID), ID);
      addItem(ITEMID, Amount);
	  } else {
      sendMessage("You Do not have 5 tickets yet!";
       }
}

By the way you coding is all tabbed the same so it makes it confusing. tab a little diffrently but not much.

Read full topic
